description.narrative: The project goal is to ensure the integrity of Mongolia’s diverse ecosystems to secure the viability of its biodiversity. It is to catalyze the expansion of Protected Area system through establishment of a network of community conservation areas.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Catalyze the strategic expansion of Mongolias PA system through establishment of a network of community conservation areas covering underrepresented terrestrial ecosystems
Hectares within the total protected area system including community conservation areas

comment.narrative: Total LPA without community managed areas is 16 Mln ha but not included in the NPA System
192 Mln ha

Total LPA without community managed areas was found to be 205 million ha based on the recent indepth survey on the LPA coverage Although it appears that the end of project target has already been reached this new figure is largely as a result of more accurate investigation on the LPA coverage which tends to be fluid as local authority can gazette and degazette or the set period for protection can expire 205 million ha includes 3 new LPAs and extension of Gulzat LPA which were facilitate directly by the project accounting for 025 million ha in total However LPA are not yet recognized as part of the national PA system With the approval of the revised SPA Law in the current version the LPAs will be officially part of the PA system
192 Mln ha

Total LPA without community managed areas was found to be 205 million ha based on the recent indepth survey on the LPA coverage Although it appears that the end of project target has already been reached this new figure is largely as a result of more accurate investigation on the LPA coverage which tends to be fluid as local authority can gazette and degazette or the set period for protection can expire 205 million ha includes 3 new LPAs and extension of Gulzat LPA which were facilitate directly by the project accounting for 025 million ha in total However LPA are not yet recognized as part of the national PA system With the approval of the revised SPA Law in the current version the LPAs will be officially part of the PA system

description.narrative: Hectares of seven underrepresented ecosystems within total protected areas system including community conservation areas

comment.narrative: Total area of underrepresented ecosystems is 102 Mln ha
80 Mlnha

Hectares of seven underrepresented ecosystems within total protected areas system including community conservation areas is 102 million ha This is according to a more accurate assessment of the LPA coverage supported by the project as above
80 Mlnha

Hectares of seven underrepresented ecosystems within total protected areas system including community conservation areas is 102 million ha This is according to a more accurate assessment of the LPA coverage supported by the project as above

description.narrative: Emplacement of institutional capacity and resource base development to ensure sustainability of Managed Resource PAs
PAAD has a fully functional staffed and government funded community conservation area resource center providing ongoing monitoring support and extension training for local conservation decisionmakers

comment.narrative: 0 functional institutional center within PAAD to support effective community conservation areas
1 functional institutional center within PAAD to support effective community conservation areas
1 resource person within PAAD is under recruitment to oversee CCAs at national level
1 functional institutional center within PAAD to support effective community conservation areas
1 resource person within PAAD is under recruitment to oversee CCAs at national level

description.narrative: Decentralised regional PA governance framework involving community and local governments Soum and Aimag established in 3 demonstration sites

comment.narrative:
0 project sites applying legally enforceable management plan to improve conservation of wideranging species and mitigate conservation threats
0 effective conservation management at regional level

3 project sites applying legally enforceable management plan to improve conservation of wideranging species and mitigate conservation threats
3 effective conservation management model developed in project target sites Khavtgar Gulzat TumenkhaanShalz LPA as center of excellence

3 project sites applying legally enforceable management plan to improve conservation of wideranging species and mitigate conservation threats
3 effective conservation management model developed in project target sites Khavtgar Gulzat TumenkhaanShalz LPA s In Gulzat an NGO is mandated by the local government for the management of the Gulzat LPA In TumenkhaanShalz LPA a joint Management council consisting representatives of stakeholders from all three soums is established for the management of this LPA In Khavtgar the local government decided the LPA will have a status of a stateowned company while a full time manager will be recruited
The following common strategic documents were approved by the local government and operational in three project areas Midterm Strategic Plan 20152025 Management Plan 20152019 and Hunting Management Plan 20152016
Specifically for TumenkhaanShalz LPA
Livestock sustainable development programme along with Livestock offset regulation has been developed for all 3 soums and approved by local government
The following standardized forms and templates for efficient management of CCAs are developed and utilized Model bylaws for community management organizations Model Terms of references of key officers Model management and business plans for LPAs model resolutions of local government

3 project sites applying legally enforceable management plan to improve conservation of wideranging species and mitigate conservation threats
3 effective conservation management model developed in project target sites Khavtgar Gulzat TumenkhaanShalz LPA as center of excellence

3 project sites applying legally enforceable management plan to improve conservation of wideranging species and mitigate conservation threats
3 effective conservation management model developed in project target sites Khavtgar Gulzat TumenkhaanShalz LPA s In Gulzat an NGO is mandated by the local government for the management of the Gulzat LPA In TumenkhaanShalz LPA a joint Management council consisting representatives of stakeholders from all three soums is established for the management of this LPA In Khavtgar the local government decided the LPA will have a status of a stateowned company while a full time manager will be recruited
The following common strategic documents were approved by the local government and operational in three project areas Midterm Strategic Plan 20152025 Management Plan 20152019 and Hunting Management Plan 20152016
Specifically for TumenkhaanShalz LPA
Livestock sustainable development programme along with Livestock offset regulation has been developed for all 3 soums and approved by local government
The following standardized forms and templates for efficient management of CCAs are developed and utilized Model bylaws for community management organizations Model Terms of references of key officers Model management and business plans for LPAs model resolutions of local government

description.narrative: Policing and enforcement of laws and regulations for biodiversity conservation results in reduction of threats and no net loss of key indicators at three pilot sites

comment.narrative:
Gulzat LPA
Total population of Argali Sheep Ovis ammon ammon 1048 as of 2012
Total household number involved in community groups 60 of total household number at Gulzat LPA
Khavtgar LPA
Population of moose Alces alces 20 as of 2010
Population of musk deer Moschus moschiferus 7 as of 2010
Population of red deer Cervus elaphus 22 as of 2010
TumenkhaanShalz LPA
No of protected wetlandslakes as habitat for key migratory bird species 0
Mongolian Gazelle Habitat fragmented andor migratory route not protected

Increase in population of Argali Sheep Ovis ammon ammon 1150

Increase in population of red deer Cervus elaphus 30

description.narrative: Establishment of new PA category for strategic PA expansion
Specific NPA legislation amended andor new regulation adopted to establish and guide effective management of community conservation areas

comment.narrative: 0 No national law andor regulation adopted as described
1 national law andor regulation adopted as described

1Regulation on Taking land under local protection 2000 is currently under revision towards setting up clear criteria and processes for LPAs including CCAs
2As a result of 1st National Forum for CBOs organized by MEGDT jointly with all donor organizations its been issued an Order 07 of Parliament Standing Committee on Agriculture and Environment dated July 09 2015 towards undertaking required actions and allocation of state budget to strengthen the governance and management of CCAs and build capacity of CBOs throughout the country
3Working group for drafting revised laws of Special Protected Area and Buffer Zone was re established due to recently restructured Ministry of Environment Green Development Tourism MEGDT The working group has refined the revised drafts through series of meetings
The following key issues reflected to the revised draft SPA Law in relation to CCA
Local protected areas are part of the national protected areas network
In addition to government its proposed collaborative and community management governance types for both state and local protected areas
4A comprehensive feasibility study on current legal framework for community conservation areas and proposal of revisionsamendments to key legislations including Law on Special Protected Areas Environmental Protection Law and Law on Land The study result has given practical basis to legitimize the community conservation areas to become an effective part of Mongolias National protected areas system and allowing for communitybased conservation management
1 national law andor regulation adopted as described

1Regulation on Taking land under local protection 2000 is currently under revision towards setting up clear criteria and processes for LPAs including CCAs
2As a result of 1st National Forum for CBOs organized by MEGDT jointly with all donor organizations its been issued an Order 07 of Parliament Standing Committee on Agriculture and Environment dated July 09 2015 towards undertaking required actions and allocation of state budget to strengthen the governance and management of CCAs and build capacity of CBOs throughout the country
3Working group for drafting revised laws of Special Protected Area and Buffer Zone was re established due to recently restructured Ministry of Environment Green Development Tourism MEGDT The working group has refined the revised drafts through series of meetings
The following key issues reflected to the revised draft SPA Law in relation to CCA
Local protected areas are part of the national protected areas network
In addition to government its proposed collaborative and community management governance types for both state and local protected areas
4A comprehensive feasibility study on current legal framework for community conservation areas and proposal of revisionsamendments to key legislations including Law on Special Protected Areas Environmental Protection Law and Law on Land The study result has given practical basis to legitimize the community conservation areas to become an effective part of Mongolias National protected areas system and allowing for communitybased conservation management

description.narrative: Number of community conservation areas legally recognized as part of the NPA system according to the amended national legislation andor regulation

comment.narrative: 0 community conservation areas legally recognized as part of the NPA system
50 community conservation areas legally recognized as part of the NPA system

30 community groups of which 15 newly established with total area of 340000 ha officially recognized and contracted with the soum governor for taking management responsibility over land and biodiversity in target 3 LPAs By March 2015 a total of 1629 community conservation areas 82 mln hectare are recorded throughout the country with user rights over forest wildlife water and pasture resources
50 community conservation areas legally recognized as part of the NPA system

30 community groups of which 15 newly established with total area of 340000 ha officially recognized and contracted with the soum governor for taking management responsibility over land and biodiversity in target 3 LPAs By March 2015 a total of 1629 community conservation areas 82 mln hectare are recorded throughout the country with user rights over forest wildlife water and pasture resources

description.narrative: End of Project target/indicator: 1. 19.2 Mln. ha 2. 80Mln. ha

comment.narrative: 1. Total Local Protected Area (without community managed areas) is 16 Mln.ha, but not included in the NPA System. 2. Total area of under-represented ecosystems is 102 Mln.ha.

1. Legal framework for protected areas revised and new category approved 2. Capacity built for ensuring the sustainability of community managed protected areas 3. Indicator animal species population increased in the target areas
1. Achieved 2. Achieved 3. Achieved
Financially close the project with transactions settled and account cleaned.
Project operationally closed and financial closure with proper checklist started.
